alert.note: Alert for Okaloosa; Santa Rosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 2:52AM EDT until March 31 at 3:15AM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM CDT FOR OKALOOSA AND SOUTHEASTERN SANTA ROSA COUNTIES... At 152 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 11 miles southeast of Laurel Hill to 9 miles south of Crestview to 4 miles southwest of Navarre Beach, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Wright, Fort Walton Beach, Crestview, Niceville, Destin, Eglin AFB, Valparaiso, Mary Esther, Ocean City, Lake Lorraine, Navarre, Shalimar, Laurel Hill, Cinco Bayou and Navarre Beach. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for northwestern Florida. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
